text: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
context: The opening verse of the Quran, known as the Basmala

text: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Self-Sustaining.
original: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ
context: Part of Ayat al-Kursi (The Throne Verse)

text: Whoever kills a soul unless for a soul or for corruption [done] in the land - it is as if he had slain mankind entirely.
original: مَن قَتَلَ نَفْسًا بِغَيْرِ نَفْسٍ أَوْ فَسَادٍ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَكَأَنَّمَا قَتَلَ النَّاسَ جَمِيعًا
transliteration: man qatala nafsan bi-ghayri nafsin aw fasādin fil-arḍi fa-ka-annamā qatala n-nāsa jamīʿā
context: Teaching about the sanctity of human life
